com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.rails.type

Class RailTypeRegular

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.rails.type.RailType
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.rails.type.RailTypeHorizontal
        • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.rails.type.RailTypeRegular
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RailTypeActivator, RailTypeDetector, RailTypePowered

    public class RailTypeRegular
extends RailTypeHorizontal
    All regular types of rails - the ones provided by Minecraft. All these rail types can slope and some of them can make curves. None of them can be used vertically, hence, it is a horizontal rail.

    Warning: all 'regular' type of rails REQUIRE a valid Rails Material type. Do not write an isType check that results in non-Rails material types.

    • Field Summary

      • getPossibleDirections

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace[] getPossibleDirections(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace railDirection)
        Gets all possible directions a Minecart can go when on regular rails. There is no 'UP' direction for vertical rails - it assumes the horizontal direction towards the wall this vertical rail is attached to instead.
        Parameters:
        railDirection - of the track
        Returns:
        all possible directions

      • isSlopeUpwardsTo

        public boolean isSlopeUpwardsTo(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock,
                                org.bukkit.block.BlockFace direction)
        Checks whether a rails block is a sloped rail leading upwards into a certain direction. This is used by vertical rails.
        Parameters:
        railsBlock -
        direction -
        Returns:
        True if the rails is an upside-down slope leading upwards the direction

      • isUpsideDown

        public boolean isUpsideDown(org.bukkit.block.Block railsBlock)
        Description copied from class: RailType
        Gets whether blocks surrounding the rails block indicate the rails is used upside-down. It is only upside-down when the block 'below' the rails is air, and a solid block exists above. This strict rule avoids regular tracks turning into upside-down tracks. Rail types that don't support upside-down Minecarts should always return false here.
        Overrides:
        isUpsideDown in class RailType
        Returns:
        True if the rails are upside-down

      • getNextPos

        public static org.bukkit.block.Block getNextPos(org.bukkit.block.Block currentTrack,
                                                org.bukkit.block.BlockFace currentDirection,
                                                org.bukkit.block.BlockFace railDirection,
                                                boolean sloped)
        Gets the next position to go to, without requesting information from the rail itself. This allows it to be used by other rail types.
        Parameters:
        currentTrack - the 'Minecart' is on
        currentDirection - the 'Minecart' is moving
        railDirection - of the currentTrack
        sloped - state of the rail - whether it is sloped
        Returns:
        the next position the 'Minecart' goes to

        public boolean isRail(com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.wrappers.BlockData blockData)
        Description copied from class: RailType
        Checks whether the block data given denote this type of Rail. This function is called from #isRail(world, x, y, z) exclusively. If the rails is more complex than one type of Block, override that method and ignore this one.
        Specified by:
        isRail in class RailType
        Parameters:
        blockData - of the Block
        Returns:
        True if it is this type of Rail, False if not

      • getJunctions

        public java.util.List<RailJunction> getJunctions(org.bukkit.block.Block railBlock)
        Description copied from class: RailType
        Gets an array containing all possible junctions that can be taken for a particular rail block. There does not have to be a valid rail at the end for a junction to exist. By default the two end points of the path returned by the logic for a 'down' direction are returned.
        Overrides:
        getJunctions in class RailType
        Parameters:
        railBlock - where this Rail Type is at
        Returns:
        list of junctions supported by this rail type, empty if no junctions are available
